Bitcoin ร่วงลงต่ำกว่า 64,000 ดอลลาร์ เนื่องจากการขายในระดับสูงสุดที่บันทึกไว้เพิ่มขึ้น: จุดพื้นตลาดอยู่ที่ไหน?

Bitcoin slips under $64K as record-high selling intensifies: Where is the bottom?

1d ago//Cointelegraph by Biraajmaan Tamuly
bitcoin
AI

Summary

TH

Bitcoin ราคาดิ่งลงอย่างหนัก 13% ในช่วง 4 วันที่ผ่านมา จนตกต่ำกว่า $64,000 การร่วงลงครั้งนี้ทำให้ราคาต่ำกว่าระดับสูงสุดของตลาดขาขึ้นปี 2021 ที่ $69,000 พร้อมกับ open interest ในตลาด futures ที่ลดลงมากกว่า $10 พันล้าน ซึ่งสะท้อนถึงการรีเซ็ตเลเวอเรจครั้งใหญ่ นักวิเคราะห์จึงเฝ้าสังเกตระดับทางเทคนิคอย่างใกล้ชิดเพื่อหาจุดที่ราคาจะแกว่งตัวขึ้น โซนความต้องการสำคัญที่ระดับ $58,000 ถึง $69,000 ได้รับการสนับสนุนจากปริมาณการซื้อขายที่มากและเส้นค่าเฉลี่ยเคลื่อนที่ 200 สัปดาห์ ตัวชี้วัดทางเทคนิคบ่งชี้ว่าแรงขายอาจใกล้ถึงจุดสูงสุดแล้ว เนื่องจาก Relative Strength Index (RSI) รายสัปดาห์ของ Bitcoin ตกต่ำกว่า 30 ซึ่งถือเป็นระดับ oversold ทางประวัติศาสตร์ และ adjusted net unrealized profit/loss (aNUPL) ติดลบเป็นครั้งแรกนับตั้งแต่ปี 2023 การเปลี่ยนแปลงของความรู้สึกในตลาดที่รวดเร็วนี้บ่งบอกถึงศักยภาพของการตั้งตัวของราคาขาลง แม้ว่าจะยังคงความเสี่ยงในแนวโน้มลดลงอยู่บ้าง

EN

Bitcoin has experienced a sharp decline, losing 13% of its value over four days to fall below $64,000. This drop has taken the price beneath the critical 2021 bull market high of $69,000, accompanied by a significant decrease in futures open interest of over $10 billion, signaling a major leverage reset. Analysts are now closely monitoring technical levels to determine where the price may find a floor. The key demand zone is identified between $58,000 and $69,000, supported by heavy transaction volume and the 200-week moving average. Technical indicators suggest that selling pressure may be peaking, as Bitcoin’s weekly Relative Strength Index (RSI) has dropped below 30—a historically oversold level—and the adjusted net unrealized profit/loss (aNUPL) has turned negative for the first time since 2023. This rapid shift in sentiment indicates a potential market bottom, though some downside risk remains.

Key Points

  • Bitcoin dropped 13% in four days, falling below the 2021 high of $69,000 as futures open interest plunged by over $10 billion.
  • A critical demand zone is identified between $58,000 and $69,000, supported by the 200-week moving average and high transaction volume.
  • Technical indicators like the weekly RSI and aNUPL show extreme oversold conditions and rapid sentiment deterioration, suggesting a potential market bottom.

Article

Bitcoin ( BTC ) has fallen 13% over the past four days, sliding to $63,844 from $79,300. It is currently trading below $69,000, which is the 2021 bull market high, a level many see as a support level. The drop was matched by a sharp decline in futures activity, with BTC’s open interest falling by more than $10 billion over the past seven days. Analysts are now focusing on the long-term technical zones and onchain indicators that may signal a major turning point for BTC. Key takeaways: Bitcoin has dropped 13% in four days, slipping below the 2021 cycle high near $69,000 after a sharp leverage reset. A key Bitcoin demand zone from $58,000 to $69,000 is supported by heavy transaction volume and the 200-week moving average. Oversold technical and sentiment indicators suggest downside pressure may be peaking for BTC, even if a relief rally fails to manifest. Why the $69,000 level matters for Bitcoin The $69,000 level represents the peak of the 2021 bull market. Prior cycle tops have historically acted as support during bear markets. In the last cycle, Bitcoin bottomed near the 2017 high of $19,600 before briefly dipping lower to about $16,000 in November 2022. Bitcoin one-month chart. Source: Cointelegraph/TradingView The current drop below $69,000 may follow this pattern. However, past cycles also show that prices can fall below prior highs before forming a final bottom. This keeps downside risk open for BTC. Bitwise European Head of Research André Dragosch noted that a large share of recent transactions occurred between $58,000 and $69,000. This range also aligns with the 200-weekly moving average near $58,000, reinforcing it as a key demand zone. Bitcoin URPD chart. Source: Glassnode Meanwhile, crypto analyst exitpump highlighted that large BTC bids are visible on order books between $68,000 and $65,000, suggesting buyer interest on dips. Related: Bitcoin price may drop below $64K as veteran raises ‘campaign selling’ alarm BTC flashes record oversold signals Market analyst Subu Trade said that Bitcoin’s weekly relative strength index (RSI) has fallen below 30. Bitcoin has reached this level only four times, and in each case, the price rallied by an average of 16% over the next four days. Bitcoin weekly chart and RSI comparison. Source: X Crypto analyst MorenoDV also noted that the adjusted net unrealized profit/loss (aNUPL) has also turned negative for the first time since 2023. This means the average holder is now at a loss. Similar conditions in 2018–2019, 2020 and 2022–2023 all led to price recoveries for BTC. While a relief rally might not take shape immediately, Moreno pointed out that the current “speed of sentiment deterioration” is much faster than the previous cycles. The analyst added, “This rapid transition suggests an acute sentiment reset rather than a gradual decline, potentially shortening the capitulation phase.” Bitcoin adjusted net unrealized profit/loss NUPL.
